content.description: Climb the steep face past 4 bolts, then join the hand crack and climb it to the top of the wall.
content.protection:
4 bolts, Single set of cams to 3"

Bolted anchor

content.description: A good climb with a crux high up the wall, nicely protected by bolts. Climb up the seam/ramp to an overhang, then face climb past 4 bolts to the top.
content.protection: 4 bolts. A single set of cams to 1" protects the first half of the climb. Chain anchors at the top.
content.location: Climbs the right leaning ramp/seam, to the right of Magician's Crack
right from 11d Whirlin Merlin , left from 5.9 Aces

content.description: Climbs the face, directly right of the Arete. Possibly shares some holds as well as it climbs out right and above the slab below. Classic plate and crimp climbing to the shared chains of "Hocus Pocus"
content.location: Left most route on the man wall, right of Hocus Pocus Arete. Either climb the slab and boulder up to the first clip or shimmy up the left boulder where hocus pocus would start. Protect the opening moves with the first clip and fire on up into the fun zone!

content.description: Climb the face past a couple of bolts to an overhang and then up a thin crack. Make some cruxy moves to leave the crack and face climb past two more bolts to the top.
content.protection: 4 bolts. Gear to 1". Chain anchors at the top.
content.location: Located on the west face, between Hocus Pocus Arete and Escape Artist

content.description: Climb the strenuous wide crack (crux) to a good ledge/ramp, then face climb up a very featured hand crack to the top. The climbing eases significantly after the crux.
content.protection: A single set of cams from .75 to 2 and doubles from 3 to 4. Shares chain anchors with Trickster.
content.location: Climbs the prominent wide crack/right facing corner to the right of Slight of Hand.

content.description: A well-protected climb with thin, sustained climbing through the first 4 bolts. After that, it is fun cruising to the top.
Great climbing up the face on fun smaller features down low.
content.protection: 9 bolts. Use the chain anchors from the routes either left or right
content.location: Directly across from the shading pine. Right of the alcove'/ crack feaures

content.description: Climbs a black streak and small crack, laybackng up small holds. Technically intensive crux can slap you off before or after clipping the 3rd bolt. Overall a stellar line with a darn hard crux but fun plated brain climbing above the 4th bolt.
content.location: Midway down the main wall, right of Alacazam and left of the slightly overhanging golden colored wall of Whirlin Merlin. Look for a thin, shallow, solid black stained crack.

content.description: Striking plated arete that separates the west and south face of the wall. Starts a bit higher off the trail then the main wall with a belay off the blocks directly below the route. The starting flared offwidth can be avoided with some creative face climbing to the left.
content.location: The Arete. Look for big plates. Scramble the slab for a comfy start and belay to the left of "Slight of Hand"

content.description: Climb the face past a bolt and up a large flake/crack to the top. Overall a fun climb that protects very well.
content.protection: 1 bolt. Single set of cams to 3". Chain anchors at the top.
content.location: Climbs through the prominent flake/crack in the middle of the west face, to the left of Hocus Pocus Arete.

content.description: Sport route with one 1" cam placement between the first and second bolt. Bouldery start off the deck to the first bolt. After the gear and second bolt, transitioning to the plated headwall above can prove tricky!
content.location: Right of the Illusionist black streack

content.description: Climb the face past two bolts, staying on the right side of the crack, then moving left at the top to clip the anchors.
content.protection: 2 bolts, single set of gear to 3"
content.location: This is the last route on the wall, to the right of the Smoke and Mirrors hand crack.
